conclusion: Analyze the image to understand the flow path of the liquid through the baffles.
Identify the connections between the containers and the baffles to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
The image shows a setup with containers labeled A, B, C, D, E, and F. There are baffles connecting these containers, with arrows indicating the flow direction.
Containers A, B, C, and D are connected to baffles, which in turn connect to containers E and F.
The liquid will flow out from containers A, B, C, and D.
The baffles are positioned to direct the flow from these containers.
The arrows indicate that the liquid from A, B, C, and D will flow through the baffles.
The baffles are connected to containers E and F.
By following the arrows, it is clear that the liquid from A, B, C, and D will flow into container E.
There are no arrows indicating that the liquid will flow into container F.
Based on the flow path and connections, the liquid will flow into container E.
